intro: Pedicularis tongtchouanensis, commonly known as the Tongtchouan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to red, often resembling orchids. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats and is adapted to cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral structure, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
